summary: This document is an internal FBI email chain from September 10, 2021, regarding a discovery request for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial. The emails request contact information for Victim Specialists and any victims, witnesses, or attorneys they communicated with, to be turned over to the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as the subject of the New York investigation alongside Ghislaine Maxwell; his case is referenced in the discovery request for the upcoming trial.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as the co-subject of the New York investigation with Jeffrey Epstein; the discovery request is for her scheduled trial.

connections.description: Both are named as subjects of the same New York investigation, with Maxwell's trial scheduled.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Trial Date
events.description: The trial for Ghislaine Maxwell in the New York investigation was scheduled to begin on this date.

events.title: FBI Discovery Request Issued
events.description: An internal FBI email chain was initiated requesting contact information for Victim Specialists and associated victims/witnesses/attorneys for discovery in the Maxwell case.

events.title: Discovery Information Deadline
events.description: The deadline set by the FBI for providing the requested discovery information to the U.S. Attorney's Office.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively gathering discovery materials for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial as of September 2021.
The request specifically sought contact information for Victim Specialists and any victims, witnesses, or attorneys they communicated with regarding the Epstein/Maxwell case.
The trial for Ghislaine Maxwell was scheduled to begin on November 29, 2021, in New York.
The FBI's Victim Services Division was involved in managing communications with victims related to the case.
The urgency of the request indicates the procedural demands of criminal discovery close to trial.
